item.title: Flooding issue, 29th January
item.description:
Reported before but no update since November 2024. Drain persistently blocked causing water to bubble out when it rains and run down the side of the road northbound causing a dangerous puddle across the road Needs investigating again
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole-lane wide potholed area, 28th January
item.description:
There is an incredibly rough patch of potholes on Hatherley Lane, opposite the entrance to Wade Court, which is now so damaged it is very dangerous to cyclists. The section has obviously been patched up at some point, but it has been deteriorating and disintegrating rapidly the last few weeks. It is so wide that it takes up most of the width of the lane, and takes up the whole remaining width when there are cars parked. As a cyclist, I have to move onto that section to pass the parked cars. I can't go all the way around the potholes because that would bring me into the opposite lane. Last week I hit the patch so hard, the contents of my basket bounced out and my front light flew off and got run over by the car behind. Today I was cut up by an impatient driver as I tried to slow down and avoid the patch. I'm afraid to signal right and go into the opposite lane (if empty), as cars behind will think I'm turning into Wade Court and undertake me. Honestly this section of road frightens me now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road signage, 28th January
item.description:
At the bottom of Birdlip Hill by the twelve bells pub there are signs saying road closed , however cars and other traffic are going up and down Birdlip Hill as normal also Lorrieâ€™s and large vans . I have spoken to Severn Trent they tell me that they have work being done on Green Lane which meets Birdlip Hill Severn Trent told me they have not closed Birdlip Hill .So can you please clarify is BIRDLIP HILL CLOSED OR NOT IF IT IS NOT CLOSED CAN YOU PLEASE ARRANGE ASAP for the signage to be removed .What this means to me and other parents is the stagecoach public service bus the 882 which takes our children to school in Cirencester it makes them late for school as the bus driver he turns around and goes up the 417 by the old air ballon pub which obviously takes him longer it is not the drivers fault he is just adhering tin the signs in front of him. THANK YOU
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Tree caught on telephone line, 28th January
item.description:
The tree has been caught on the telephone wire for a few days and is pulling the wire down. Both are moving in the wind. The area has been coned off but the tree is likely to fall past the cones onto the other side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Kingsditch, Tewkesbury

item.description:
